soc.message
Class BoardLayout

java.lang.Object
  soc.message.Message
      soc.message.BoardLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class BoardLayout
extends Message

This message contains the board layout information. That is, the hex layout, the number layout, and where the robber is. This does not contain information about where the player's pieces are on the board.

This message sends the standard board layout of the original game, Board.BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL. As of version 1.1.08, there is a newer board layout for game expansions. See the new message type BOARDLAYOUT2.

Unlike BoardLayout2, the dice numbers are mapped before sending over the network, and unmapped when received. This is because of a change in Board.getNumberLayout() in 1.1.08, the version which introduced BoardLayout2. Older clients/servers will still need the mapping done, so it's now done here instead of in Board.

Author:
Robert S. Thomas
See Also:
Serialized Form

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Render the BoardLayout in human-readable form. In version 1.1.09 and later, the hexLayout and numberLayout contents are included, and for convenience, robberHex is in hexadecimal instead of base-10

Specified by:
